title: Add the missing Honeydew book PDFs so the library can open them

requirements.text: Add the missing Honeydew book PDF files to the frontend static assets so every backend `Book.assetPath` currently returned by `getBooks()` resolves to a real, publicly accessible file path.
acceptanceCriteria: All of these URLs return a PDF (no 404) when loaded in the browser: `/assets/The_Best_Christmas_Present_in_the_World.pdf`, `/assets/The_Ant_and_the_Cricket.pdf`, `/assets/The_Tsunami.pdf`, `/assets/Glimpses_of_the_Past.pdf`, `/assets/Geography_Lesson.pdf`, `/assets/Bepin_Choudhurys_Lapse_of_Memory.pdf`, `/assets/The_Summit_Within.pdf`, `/assets/Macavity_The_Mystery_Cat.pdf`, `/assets/This_is_Jodys_Fawn.pdf`, `/assets/A_Visit_to_Cambridge.pdf`, `/assets/The_Last_Bargain.pdf`, `/assets/A_Short_Monsoon_Diary.pdf`, `/assets/The_Great_Stone_Face_I.pdf`, `/assets/The_Great_Stone_Face_II.pdf`
From the Landing page, clicking any book card navigates to the Reader page and the PDF loads via the iframe OR can be opened via the “Open PDF” button without a missing-file error

requirements.text: Ensure the backend book catalog returned by `getBooks()` corresponds to the actual added book resources (PDF filenames/paths) and, if any filenames differ from the added assets, update `Book.assetPath` values to match exactly.
acceptanceCriteria: For every book returned by `getBooks()`, the Reader page’s normalized PDF URL points to an existing file (or a valid remote URL) and does not 404
No book entry in the UI links to a missing/nonexistent PDF due to filename or path mismatch

constraints: Use English for all user-facing text.
Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (no additional canisters/services).
Do not edit files under `frontend/src/components/ui` or the immutable hook files listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: Do not add new authentication providers (Internet Identity only).
Do not add external databases or third-party storage/CDN dependencies.
